subject: RE: [junit] SOAPEnvelope ClassCastException in using swingui.TestRunner
msgSnippet: Hi, Yes, this sort of problem is documented in the JUnit FAQ: http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/faq/faq.htm#running_8
messageBody:
Hi,

Yes, this sort of problem is documented in the JUnit FAQ:
http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/faq/faq.htm#running_8
http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/faq/faq.htm#running_9

Scott Stirling

> -----Original Message-----
> From: msenthilkumar76 <msenthilkumar76@...>
> [mailto:msenthilkumar76@...]
>
> Hi,
> I am writing test code for soap service. I wanted to print xml stream
> to a file.
>
> While I write the content of SOAPEnvelope object using
> textui.TestRunner, I am able to cast the soapenvelope to
> org.dom4j.Node.
>
> While I run the same code using swingui.TestRunner the same object
> was now being some other interface and gives a classcast exception.
> Interesting thing is the same thing works when I unchecked "reload
> classes every run".
>
> Are you aware of this problem? Any fix to this?
>
> thanks
> Senthil
